data.title: Peaceful and beautiful building
data.text: I love the downtown library! The selection of books, MP3 playaways, lunch time speakers, exhibits, and activities are impressive. The staff is informative and very helpful is you cannot locate something physically or electronically. Impressive architecture with beautiful bronze doors. Go get your free library card today!

data.title: NOT BY THE BOOK
data.text:
There are any number of reviews about this handsome library with its splendid holdings and activities.But is it the PC police at work once more which leaves out why I was totally uncomfortable there?
There is an unfortunate homeless problem at the park that faces the library and it spills over into the building.You might want to sit down at a table to read but homeless people with all their problems are sitting in those seats.And they are standing at the entrance and they are in the halls.
There is a visible police presence at the park ;locals blame the city administration for refusing to address the situation.This is not a library that I find welcoming and if I lived in Nashville,I would never permit my children to use it.

data.title: Best library
data.text: This is a beautiful building! The kids section is amazing. If you are visiting Nashville with young kids, this is a great pit stop to let them play. Black history section is very informative. Really nice that they provide free parking for 1 1/2 hours but be sure to not exceed that time or you pay for all.

data.title: WOW!
data.text:
Our 7 year old daughter loved this library! So interactive!
We went several times during our stay!  If you get a chance to take your kids, DO IT!

data.title: Great Library
data.text: We were downtown for the book festival and spent some time in the library. This is beautiful historic building on the middle of downtown. The library is very well setup and a pleasure to walk through. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is an attached public garage and there is a ticket validation station in the library that gives you the first 1 1/2 hours free.

data.title: Beautiful building
data.text: Went to a book Sale today and also got a chance to see the beautiful architecture of the Nashville library. It is a special place. In previously met President Jimmy Carter here at a book signing.  This library has it all!  Parking garage attached, coffee shop and tons of books and resources.  Awesome friendly staff!  One of the best libraries I have visited!

data.title: Beautiful Library!
data.text: This library is wonderful! The children's and teen areas have amazing creative spaces. There are a few large reading rooms and an art gallery. You must check out the Civil Rights Room - Awesome!!

data.title: Civil Rights Room worth a visit.
data.text:
I only went to the library to see the civil rights exhibition but the building was beautiful.
The Civil Rights Room  is small but very interesting.  The room contains many works of literature and reference on the subject but for the casual visitor it is an amazing educational experience.  The walls display powerful images associated with the non-violent protests regarding segregation in the South.
There is a seating area in the centre which is representative of the sit-in counter protests.  Along this there is a time line giving information about the Civil Rights Movement across America and below it is a time line providing local stories that were happening at the time with a lot of emphasis on the desegregation of schools.  I am British and although I was aware of people such as Rosa Parks and Martin Luther King my knowledge around what was happening around that time was very sketchy.
I spent a good hour in the room reading the text of the exhibition and I left with a much greater understanding and respect for the people involved and would recommend a visit to anyone

data.title: Beautiful
data.text: This library is absolutely breath taking! It has a beautiful entrance way. The people are very helpful and friendly. There is a puppet theater and an absolutely wonderful children's section.

data.title: Beautiful Building
data.text: Absolutely beautiful Library with reasonable parking garage attached. Friendly staff. Walk up to the rooftop garden area, a very pleasant area to sit and read a book.

data.title: Public Library
data.text: Looks like a good library with excellent staff. But the guide book review of the civil rights exhibit is better than the reality.

data.title: Beautiful inside and out
data.text: Our downtown library is a must see for locals and visitors. It's beautiful from outside and once inside, the views to the outside are incredible. The resources there are amazing, including genealogy charts, plenty of music, and books on tape too. Lost of activities. Parking garage is safe and free if you get your ticket punched inside the library.

data.title: Toddler entertainment!
data.text:
They have a 2nd floor area dedicated to small children.  Puppet shows, Legos, rock wall, toy trains, climbing bridge and castle...and of course, books!  This is the reason I gave it 5 stars.  Our kids were not ready to leave after about an hour...

It's in downtown Nashville and parking cost us $10 for 1.5 hours. (I'm not sure if they have "library" parking somewhere else.)  They have a museum area dedicated to a baseball artist. They have free concerts in the courtyard. And they have some pretty good views off the reading room. A section of the 3rd floor was dedicated to the Deaf.  We did not investigate any of the library's literature, but there were a lot of quiet reading rooms available.

data.title: Very helpful and infromative for history lovers
data.text: You can walk around the displays to learn more about TN. They have a huge area of geneology if you are in to that..  Otherwise a brief walk around the main area is recommended.

data.title: Great Free Family visit
data.text: Great children's area. We came for Courtyard Concert which alone was worth the visit. Awesome jazz performance! We were early and able to catch story time. We all thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

data.title: Great place to relax
data.text: The architecture and displays in this library are incredible. You could stroll through for hours just enjoying the history in paintings and pictures. Of course, books, internet, and a great staff really help make this place one of the best libraries in the US!

data.title: Pretty amazing kids area
data.text: Visiting from out of town. Saw first rate puppet show. Amazing area for kids. I can feel the value the city places in this location.

data.title: Nice
data.text: The people that work here are very helpful.  We were working on genealogy and the gentleman that worked in that area was very helpful.

data.title: More Than Books
data.text: Not like you need more to make this a part of your to do rotation. This is a great old building in a vibrant spot with the coolest stuff inside. Like that's not enough, they have programs for everyone and anyone. This is my fallback.

data.title: Educational experience
data.text: Enjoy using this library, especially for genealogy purposes.  So much information available right at your fingertips.
